thread.title: Rand Paul strategist claims Marco Rubio aide punched him at...
thread.title_full: Rand Paul strategist claims Marco Rubio aide punched him at... | www.ajc.com

author: Cox Media Group National Content Desk
title: Rand Paul strategist claims Marco Rubio aide punched him at...
text:
An aide for Republican Sen. Marco Rubio's presidential campaign is accused of throwing a political punch – literally.
According to the Detroit News , John Yob, national political director for Republican Sen. Rand Paul of Kentucky, said Rubio's deputy campaign manager, Rich Beeson, punched him in the face Thursday night at a bar on Michigan's Mackinac Island. The Republican strategists were in town for a leadership conference.
>> Read more trending stories
Associated Press Rand Paul (left) and Marco Rubio "Last night, I went to a bar on Mackinac Island for the GOP Mackinac Conference," Yob wrote Friday on Facebook . "I ran into a guy named Rich Beeson, who frankly I didn't even know who it was at first because he isn't relevant in our political world. Anyway, he is Marco Rubio's national campaign manager. He literally physically assaulted me by punching me in the face. The state police are looking for him. I have it on video, from multiple angles. This will play out in the national media in the next few hours."
Surveillance video from Horn's Gaslight Bar appears to show a man striking someone who looks like Yob, the Detroit News reported . Watch the footage here.
>> Click here to watch a video report from WXMI
View Larger Rand Paul strategist claims Marco Rubio aide punched him at Michigan bar Political blogger Brandon Hall told WXMI that he saw the altercation and called the punch "unprovoked." Politico.com reporter Marc Caputo, however, said Yob "lied and/or exaggerated" about the incident.
Neither the Detroit News nor WXMI was able to reach Rubio or Beeson for comment, but WXMI said it obtained emails that Rubio campaign manager Terry Sullivan wrote to Yob, first joking about Yob's claims, then apologizing after he realized that Yob was serious.
Yob later issued a statement saying "the Rubio campaign is not to blame," but he urged the Florida senator to fire Beeson.
Mackinac Island police have looked into the incident and passed along their report to the county prosecutor.
Read more here.
